intro: Calectasia demarzii, commonly known as the silver mistflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is also known as the goldenrod family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a mist-like appearance. Calectasia demarzii typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its unique and elegant floral display.
